definition: (of a woman) to adorn oneself/makeup/adornment/trousseau/stage makeup and costume
to apply makeup conspicuously (idiom)/dressed to the nines and wearing makeup

sentences.english: Wearing too much make-up can mask the scent that attracts men during ovulation.
sentences.chinese: 浓妆会掩盖排卵期女性特有的吸引男人的气味。

sentences.english: Anna has poshed herself up for the Christmas party.
sentences.chinese: 安娜为了参加圣诞晚会而浓妆艳抹。

sentences.english: The total affordable heavy makeup, dress, high heels, elegant, beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 浓妆淡抹总相宜，连衣裙，高跟鞋，优雅，明媚。

sentences.english: She applied heavy makeup to her face.
They don't wear much makeup. Their outfits are unremarkable.
sentences.chinese: 她们不化浓妆，穿着平凡。

sentences.english: I wore a lot of make-up, including false eyelashes, and left my hair down.
sentences.chinese: 还化了浓妆，包括假睫毛，把头发披散下来。

sentences.english: I was looking at her face, she really can carry heavy make-up even with smoky eyes.
sentences.chinese: 看著她一张可肩起浓妆的脸，烟熏眼也很适合她呢。

sentences.english: She tarted up in the Ladies.
sentences.chinese: 她在女盥洗室里浓妆艳抹了一番。

sentences.english: She wore heavy makeup to mask the dark circles under her eyes.
sentences.chinese: 她化浓妆以掩饰她的黑眼圈。

sentences.english: She pushed her auburn hair back and raised her painted face.
sentences.chinese: 她把棕色的头发放到耳后，仰起铺满浓妆的脸。

sentences.english: From a male perspective I never had caredfor women that wore a lot of make up.
sentences.chinese: 从一名男性的角度，我从不喜欢浓妆艳抹的女性。

sentences.english: Can make up weak appropriately, do not wear heavy make-up.
sentences.chinese: 可以适当地化些淡妆，不要浓妆艳抹。

sentences.english: She tarted up before she went out.
sentences.chinese: 她出门之前浓妆艳抹了一番。

definition: to apply makeup conspicuously (idiom)/dressed to the nines and wearing makeup
(of a woman) to adorn oneself/makeup/adornment/trousseau/stage makeup and costume

lit. to present oneself confidently to the emperor, without makeup (as did the sister of Yang Guifei 楊貴妃|杨贵妃[Yang2 Gui4 fei1]) (idiom)/fig. (of a woman) to show one's natural features, without makeup/to present oneself just as one is, without artifice
to remove makeup/(old) to take off formal dress and ornaments
variant of 裝扮|装扮[zhuang1 ban4]
cosmetic contact lens/big eye contact lens/circle contact lens
to decorate/to dress/to make up/to adorn/manner of dressing/style of dress
to decorate/to adorn/to dress up/to disguise oneself
